nor among the killed! Kutuzov writes . . ." and he screamed as piercingly as if he wished to drive the princess away by that scream . . . "Killed!" 
The princess did not fall down or faint. She was already pale, but on hearing these words her face changed and something brightened in her beautiful, radiant eyes. It was as if joy a supreme joy apart from the joys and sorrows of this world overflowed the great grief within her. She forgot all fear of her father, went up to him, took his hand, a
